  • Constructor Details

    • JSInputWidget

      public JSInputWidget(haven.Coord c, String header, String label)
      Constructor for JSInputWidget. This should not be modified. A brief example of usage is provided below. Example: var iw = jgetInputWidget(250, 250, "Input something", "Label text"); var ID = 0; if (iw != null) { if (iw.waitForPress(20000)) { ID = iw.intValue(); iw.close(); } else { iw.close(); } } This example shows how to read a numeric value into the variable ID. When the "Ok" button is pressed in the window, it hides instead of closing, so it is good practice to close the window using the close() method when it is no longer needed.

  • Method Details

    • waitForPress

      public boolean waitForPress(int timeout)
      Waits for the "Ok" button to be pressed.
      Parameters:
      Integer - timeout - The duration to wait (in milliseconds).
      Returns:
      A Boolean value. true if the "Ok" button was pressed within the specified timeout period, false otherwise.

    • textValue

      public String textValue()
      Retrieves the text from the input field.
      Returns:
      A String containing the text input, or an empty String if the "Ok" button has not been pressed.

    • intValue

      public int intValue()
      Retrieves the text in the input field as an integer value.
      Returns:
      An Integer value of the input. If the input cannot be converted, then a 0 is returned.

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the input widget.
